overview_of_class: This course will give students a basic grounding in scientific research on social and personality development in infancy and childhood, but also in adolescence and adulthood.   This course will also cover some basic facts regarding research methods and theories that are used in the science of child development.  Students will learn how children develop socially over time, how personality develops, and gain an appreciation for scientific research on child and adult development.
name: Social and Personality Development
title: WCAS PSYCH 326-0-20 Social and Personality Development
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must complete Psych 205-0 before taking this course.

Prerequisite: Students must complete Psych 205-0 before taking this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will give students a basic grounding in scientific research on social and personality development in infancy and childhood, but also in adolescence and adulthood. This course will also cover some basic facts regarding research methods and theories that are used in the science of child development. Students will learn how children develop socially over time, how personality develops, and gain an appreciation for scientific research on child and adult development.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Psych 205-Research Methods plus at least one of the following: Psych 204-Social Psychology, Psych 215-Psychology of Personality, Psych 218-Developmental Psychology

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will gain undergraduate-level mastery of the main areas of social and personality development, primarily in childhood, but also in adulthood.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: The Art and Science of Personality Development, by Dan P. McAdams, 2015. ISBN: 9781462519958

class_attributes:
Social & Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory
subject: PSYCH
